Platform.Title: OSU Streptococcus pyogenes M1 and M18 microarray-SDHHbtail
Platform.Manufacturer: Pancholi Laboratory, OSU, Columbus; Public Health Res Institute-Newark
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: Sense strand oligonucleotides with mainly 55-mer, representing the 1,769 open reading frames (ORFs) in the genome of S. pyogenes Type M1, strain SF370 and 175 ORFs (those absent in SF370 strain) of Type M18 (Strain MGAS8232) were designed and produced by Illumina (http://www.illumina.com). They were obtained as 1.35 nmoles quantity at 50 uM concentration in 27 ul of water in shallow well plates.
Platform.Description: The oligonucleotides were spotted onto poly-L-lysine microarray slides by a robotic microarrayer (Omni GRAD 100 microarrayer) using 12 pin spotter at the Center of Applied Genomics (CAGE) of the Public Health Research Institute, Newark, NJ. Arrays were distributed in 16 blocks each with 12 columns and 12 rows.

Column.Name: Name-Spot
Column.Description: Spot reference numbaer

Column.Name: Block
Column.Description: the position of an oligo-spot in a given Block

Column.Name: Column
Column.Description: the position of an oligo-spot in a given column of the Block

Column.Name: Row
Column.Description: the position of an oligo-spot in a given row of the Column and the block

Column.Name: Location
Column.Description: Location of a gene in the M1SF370 genome

Column.Name: Strand
Column.Description: Positive or negative orientation of the gene

Column.Name: Length
Column.Description: Length of a gene product-aminoacid

Column.Name: Gene
Column.Description: given gene name

Column.Name: Code
Column.Description: One-letter abbreviations for the functional categories (Nucleic Acids Res, 28:33-36 (2000)

Column.Name: COG
Column.Description: Clusters of Orthologous Groups of proteins

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: Entrez Gene

Column.Name: SEQUENCE
Column.Description: probe nucleotide sequence (5'-3')

Column.Name: SPOT_ID
Column.Description: spot identifier

Column.Name: Main function
Column.Description: Major functional categoty

Column.Name: subfunction
Column.Description: specific function

Sample.Title: Experiment-1-M1-SDHHBtail vs wild-type

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Streptococus pyogenes parent strain type M1 SF370 was obtained from ATCC and grown to late log phase culture. Total RNA was isolated from this wild-type strain.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Washed streptococci were lysed with the amidase enzyme (lysin) and total RNA was extracted using Qiagen RNeasy Mini kit ( cat# 74104). RNA was digested with RNAse-free DNase-I (Invitrogen) and RNA quality and quantity was analyzed using Nucleic acid Bioanalyzer (Agilent technologies).
Channel.Label: Alexafluor 647
Channel.Label-Protocol: From the total RNA, cDNA was synthesized using random hexamer, dNTPs (except that dTTP was replaced by the same amount of amino-allyl dUTP to incorporate dUTP into first-strand cDNA) and each reverse transcriptase reaction (Superscript II Reverse Transcriptase, Invitrogen). The amino allyl-modified cDNA was purified using QIAquick PCR spin columns (Qiagen). Purified cDNA from the wild-type strain was labeled with Alexafluor-647 in 0.3M sodium carbonate (pH=9.0) for 1 h (dark) according to the manufacturer’s instructions (Molecular probes/Invitrogen.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Streptococus pyogenes M-Hbtail mutant was derived from the wild type strain. Total RNA was isolated from this mutant strain strain. ( Boel et al [2005] Infect. Immun.73:6237.)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Washed streptococci were lysed with the amidase enzyme (lysin) and total RNA was extracted using Qiagen RNeasy Mini kit ( cat# 74104). RNA was digested with RNAse-free DNase-I (Invitrogen) and RNA quality and quantity was analyzed using Nucleic acid Bioanalyzer (Agilent technologies).
Channel.Label: AlexaFluor 555
Channel.Label-Protocol: From the total RNA, cDNA was synthesized using random hexamer, dNTPs (except that dTTP was replaced by the same amount of amino-allyl dUTP to incorporate dUTP into first-strand cDNA) and each reverse transcriptase reaction (Superscript II Reverse Transcriptase, Invitrogen). The amino allyl-modified cDNA was purified using QIAquick PCR spin columns (Qiagen). Purified cDNA from the wild-type strain was labeled with Alexafluor-555 in 0.3M sodium carbonate (pH=9.0) for 1 h (dark) according to the manufacturer’s instructions (Molecular probes/Invitrogen,

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization protocol The labeled cDNA-probes (wild-type and mutant strains) were combined and purified using QIAquickTM PCR spin columns (Qiagen). The labeled cDNA was hybridized with the array slide in the hybridization buffer (3xSSC, salmon testes (sonicated and denatured) DNA and 0.25% SDS) at 63C overnight using hybridization chamber (HybrChambTm, GeneMachines). The hybridized array slides were washed consecutively with 1 x SSC, 0.2 x SSC and 0.05 x SSC each with 0.03% SDS.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scan protocol Signals of the bound reagents on the microarray spots in terms of relative fluorescence values were measured and quantified by a laser scanner (GenePix 4100 ) at 10um/pixel resolution. The resulting images were processed using Gene Pix Pro software (version 4.0, Axon instruments).
Sample.Description: Comparison of gene expression in the M1-SDHHBtail mutant vs the parental strain M1 SF370
Sample.Data-Processing: The web application CARMAweb (Comprehensive R based microarray analysis web service) was used for the normalization and analysis of microarray data. All raw data (in the form of *. GPR files) were uploaded to the web application in the data directory. Using appropriate navigation tree, background correction from the foreground signals was applied and within microarray normalization was achieved using the Lowess method. Genes flagged as bad spots by the scanning software were excluded from the analysis and all flagged spots were termed as "null". The normalized data were then subjected to fold-change analysis and t-statistics using Bioconductor multtest package. This package employs the moderated t-statistics from the LIMMA package (liner models for micro array data) based on bayesian Significantly differentially expressed genes were those showing log2 values > 1.0( up regualted) and Log2 values < 1 (down-regulated), Bioconductors Multtest package provided suitable method (e.g. Benjamini and Hochberg) adjust P values according to multiple hypothesis testing problems.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Normalized log2 ratio of mutant/wildtype

Column.Name: Log2-Exp-1Slide#28M1647-SDHHbtail555 Red
Column.Description: Normalized Log2 values of the wild-type red signal

Column.Name: Log2-Exp-1Slide#28M1647-SDHHbtail555- Green
Column.Description: Normalized Log2 values of the SDHHbtail mutant green signal

Column.Name: Exp-1Slide#28M1647-SDHHbtail555- Red
Column.Description: Normalized values of the wild-type red signal

Column.Name: Exp-1Slide#28M1647-SDHHbtail555- Green
Column.Description: Normalized values of the SDHHbtail mutant green signal

Column.Description: Fluorescence value for M1-SDHHbtail Alexafluor555(Green)

Sample.Title: Experiment-7-M1-SDHHBtail vs wild-type

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Streptococus pyogenes parent strain type M1 SF370 was obtained from ATCC and grown to late log phase culture. Total RNA was isolated from this wild-type strain
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Washed streptococci were lysed with the amidase enzyme (lysin) and total RNA was extracted using Qiagen RNeasy Mini kit ( cat# 74104). RNA was digested with RNAse-free DNase-I (Invitrogen) and RNA quality and quantity was analyzed using Nucleic acid Bioanalyzer (Agilent technologies).
Channel.Label: Alexafluor 647
Channel.Label-Protocol: From the total RNA, cDNA was synthesized using random hexamer, dNTPs (except that dTTP was replaced by the same amount of amino-allyl dUTP to incorporate dUTP into first-strand cDNA) and each reverse transcriptase reaction (Superscript II Reverse Transcriptase, Invitrogen). The amino allyl-modified cDNA was purified using QIAquick PCR spin columns (Qiagen). Purified cDNA from the wild-type strain was labeled with Alexafluor-647 in 0.3M sodium carbonate (pH=9.0) for 1 h (dark) according to the manufacturer’s instructions (Molecular probes/Invitrogen.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Streptococus pyogenes M-Hbtail mutant was derived from the wild type strain. Total RNA was isolated from this mutant strain strain. ( Boel et al [2005] Infect. Immun.73:6237.)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Washed streptococci were lysed with the amidase enzyme (lysin) and total RNA was extracted using Qiagen RNeasy Mini kit ( cat# 74104). RNA was digested with RNAse-free DNase-I (Invitrogen) and RNA quality and quantity was analyzed using Nucleic acid Bioanalyzer (Agilent technologies).
Channel.Label: AlexaFluor 555
Channel.Label-Protocol: From the total RNA, cDNA was synthesized using random hexamer, dNTPs (except that dTTP was replaced by the same amount of amino-allyl dUTP to incorporate dUTP into first-strand cDNA) and each reverse transcriptase reaction (Superscript II Reverse Transcriptase, Invitrogen). The amino allyl-modified cDNA was purified using QIAquick PCR spin columns (Qiagen). Purified cDNA from the wild-type strain was labeled with Alexafluor-555 in 0.3M sodium carbonate (pH=9.0) for 1 h (dark) according to the manufacturer’s instructions (Molecular probes/Invitrogen,

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization protocol The labeled cDNA-probes (wild-type and mutant strains) were combined and purified using QIAquickTM PCR spin columns (Qiagen). The labeled cDNA was hybridized with the array slide in the hybridization buffer (3xSSC, salmon testes (sonicated and denatured) DNA and 0.25% SDS) at 63C overnight using hybridization chamber (HybrChambTm, GeneMachines). The hybridized array slides were washed consecutively with 1 x SSC, 0.2 x SSC and 0.05 x SSC each with 0.03% SDS.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scan protocol Signals of the bound reagents on the microarray spots in terms of relative fluorescence values were measured and quantified by a laser scanner (GenePix 4100 ) at 10um/pixel resolution. The resulting images were processed using Gene Pix Pro software (version 4.0, Axon instruments).
Sample.Description: Comparison of gene expression in the M1-SDHHBtail mutant vs the parental strain M1-SF370
Sample.Data-Processing: The web application CARMAweb (Comprehensive R based microarray analysis web service) was used for the normalization and analysis of microarray data. All raw data (in the form of *. GPR files) were uploaded to the web application in the data directory. Using appropriate navigation tree, background correction from the foreground signals was applied and within microarray normalization was achieved using the Lowess method. Genes flagged as bad spots by the scanning software were excluded from the analysis and all flagged spots were termed as "null" (kept empty). The normalized data were then subjected to fold-change analysis and t-statistics using Bioconductor multtest package. This package employs the moderated t-statistics from the LIMMA package (liner models for micro array data) based on bayesian Significantly differentially expressed genes were those showing log2 values > 1.0( up regulated) and Log2 values < 1 (down-regulated), Bioconductors Multtest package provided suitable method (e.g. Benjamini and Hochberg) adjust P values according to multiple hypothesis testing problems.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Normalized log2 ratio of mutant/wildtype

Column.Name: Log2-Exp-7Slide#49M1647-SDH Hbtail555-Red
Column.Description: Log2 Flourescence intensity values M1-wild-type (red)

Column.Name: Log2-Exp-7Slide#49M1647-SDH Hbtail555-green
Column.Description: Log2 Flourescence intensity values M1-SDHHbtail (green)

Column.Name: Exp-7Slide#49M1647-SDH Hbtail555-red
Column.Description: Flourescence intensity values M1-wild-type (red)

Column.Name: Exp-7Slide#49M1647-SDH Hbtail555-green
Column.Description: Flourescence intensity values M1-SDHHbtail (green)

Series.Title: Microarray analysis for differential gene expression in M1-SDHHbtail
Series.Summary: A total of 215 gene were found to be differentially expressed; 90 of them were up regulated and 125 genes were down regulated. Most notably the functional categories that were affected include Virulence genes, carbohydrate genes and lipid synthesis genes. Some of the virulence genes were down regulated by more than 16-32 fold. These results indicate that SDH plays an important role in the regulation of virulence.
Series.Overall-Design:
S.pyogenes strain SF370 (wild-type) was procured from ATCC (ATCC 700294). M1-SDHHbtail (SDH cytoplasmically retained) mutant strain PGB-1 was obtained using pFW5 vector as described before ( Boel G. Jin, H. and Pancholi, V. (2005). Inhibition of cell surface export of groupA streptococcal anchorless surface dehydrogenase (SDH) affects bacterial adherence and antiphagocytic properties. Infect. Immun. 73:6237-6248).
Both strains (M1-Wild-type and PGB1(M1-SDHHbtail) were grown in Todd-Hewitt broth to their late log phase. Bacteria were harvested by centrifugation and washed twice with sterile PBS. Total RNA was isolated from these washed streptococci using Qiagen RNeasy Mini kit.
For synthesis and labeling of cDNA, 20 ug of total RNA, 1.5 ug of random hexamer, 0.5mM dNTPs (except that 0.2mM of dTTP was replaced by the same amount of amino-allyl dUTP to incorporate dUTP into first-strand cDNA) were used in each reverse transcriptase reaction (Superscript II Reverse Transcriptase, Invitrogen).
Purified cDNA preparations from the wild-type and PGB1 mutant strains were labeled with either Alexafluor-555 or Alexafluor-647 depending on the experimental design ( i.e. dye swap experiment). Differentially labeled probes were then combined and purified. Using three independently isolated RNA preparations (biological replicates), a total of 8 experiments (incorporating dye swaps) were performed. Accordingly eight hybridization measurements for this mutant were performed. Thus Exp-1 and -2 (GSM380310, GSM380320) are the technical replicates of the biological sample-1, Exp-3,-4 and -5 (GSM380321, GSM380322, GSM380331) are technical replicates of biological sample-2 and Exp-6,-7, and -8 (GSM380332,GSM380333, GSM380334) are technical replicates of the biological sample-3.
Signals of the bound reagents on the microarray spots in terms of relative fluorescence values were measured and quantified by a laser scanner (GenePix 4100 ) at 10um/pixel resolution. The resulting images were processed using Gene Pix Pro software (version 4.0, Axon instruments). The raw data were obtained in the form of GenPix *.gpr output files.
The web application CARMAweb (Comprehensive R based microarray analysis web service) was used for the normalization and analysis of microarray data. All raw data (in the form of *. GPR files) were uploaded to the web application in the data directory. Using appropriate navigation tree, background correction from the foreground signal was applied and within microarray normalization was achieved using the Lowess method. Genes flagged as bad spots by the scanning software were excluded from the analysis and all flagged spots were given a weight of zero. The normalized data were then subjected to fold-change analysis and t-statistics using Bioconductor multtest package. CARMAweb allows to set Log2 cut-off values for both the M (regulation) and the A (average expression) values. Differentially expressed genes (Log2 values of Mutant647-red vs. wild-type555-green or Log2 values Mutant-555(green) vs Wild-type 647-red) were defined based on cut-off value >1 Log2< i.e. all genes that show a two or more-fold up- or down-regulation. Bioconductors Multtest package provided suitable method to adjust P values according to multiple hypothesis testing problems.
